cboCostEstimates.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs on July 19, 2022
cboCostEstimates.title: H.R. 6671, a bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure that a member of the Armed Forces, granted a general discharge under honorable conditions on the sole basis that such member failed to obey a lawful order to receive a vaccine for COVID-19

constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 26 (Wednesday, February 9, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. FITZGERALD:
H.R. 6671.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
clause 18 of section 8 of article I of the Constitution.
[Page H1115]

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 15 - 13.

title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure that a member of the Armed Forces, granted a general discharge under honorable conditions on the sole basis that such member failed to obey a lawful order to receive a vaccine for COVID-19, is eligible for certain educational assistance administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.
